medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 5 months of age with the first episode characterized by spontaneous perforation and pus drainage from the left ear. Over the following months, Sam experienced six additional episodes of acute otitis media, typically characterized by cold symptoms, irritability, and/or fever, occurring in May, June (twice), August, September, and November of 2001. Symptoms have persisted with episodes approximately once a month before prophylactic antibiotics were administered.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Buckle fracture of the right radius and ulna. Normal growth and developmental milestones achieved. Immunizations are up to date.
medical_history.family_history: First cousins on his paternal side with recurrent otitis media.
medical_history.social_history: Sam lives with his mother, father, and a healthy older brother. He is not exposed to cigarette smoke and has had limited exposure to other children.
